sections.title: Admission
sections.text: Admitted for routine annual physical examination and hypertension management. Patient presented for scheduled follow-up with no acute complaints.

sections.title: Hospital Course
sections.text: Patient underwent comprehensive physical examination. Blood pressure found to be elevated at 145/90 mmHg despite current medication regimen. No signs of end-organ damage. Patient counseled on lifestyle modifications.

sections.title: Diagnostics
sections.text: Vital signs monitoring showed consistent elevation in blood pressure. Annual laboratory work ordered including lipid panel and renal function tests.

sections.title: Discharge Medications
sections.text: Continue Lisinopril 10mg PO daily. Patient counseled on medication compliance and timing.

sections.title: Follow-up
sections.text: Internal Medicine follow-up in 6 months. Patient advised to monitor blood pressure at home and return if readings consistently > 150/90.

sections.title: Admission
sections.text: Admitted for routine diabetes follow-up visit. Patient with Type 2 diabetes mellitus on Metformin therapy presenting for quarterly monitoring.

sections.title: Hospital Course
sections.text: Patient reported excellent glucose control with home readings averaging 120-140 mg/dL. No episodes of hypoglycemia. Good medication compliance noted. Physical examination unremarkable.

sections.title: Diagnostics
sections.text: HbA1c ordered for diabetes monitoring. Routine diabetic foot examination performed - no ulcers or deformities noted. Peripheral pulses intact.

sections.title: Discharge Medications
sections.text: Continue Metformin 500mg PO twice daily with meals. Patient counseled on continued adherence to diabetic diet.

sections.title: Follow-up
sections.text: Endocrinology follow-up in 3 months. Patient advised to continue home glucose monitoring and return if experiencing symptoms of hyperglycemia or hypoglycemia.
